Q: XAMPP - Port 80 in use by "Unable to open process" with PID 4! 12 A:

Solution

Stop and disable World Wide Web Publishing Service:

  1. Press Win + R, type services.msc, press Enter.
  2. Find World Wide Web Publishing Service, right-click → Stop.
  3. Double-click service → set Startup type to Disabled.
  4. Restart XAMPP → Apache should start.

Optional check: netstat -ano | findstr :80 to ensure PID 4 is gone.

Good luck! 🎉

Q: Import "pygame" could not be resolved A:

import pygame

import random

import sys

pygame.init() # Bu satır HATASIZ çalışacak!

# Ekran ayarları

WIDTH, HEIGHT = 800, 400

screen = pygame.display.set_mode((WIDTH, HEIGHT))

pygame.display.set_caption("IROTEZN GAME - Zombi Kaçış! 🧟‍♂️")

# Renkler (aynı)

WHITE = (255, 255, 255)

BLACK = (0, 0, 0)

GRAY = (128, 128, 128)

DARK_GRAY = (60, 60, 60)

BROWN = (70, 50, 30)

RUINED_BROWN = (100, 80, 60)

ZOMBIE_GREEN = (0, 150, 0)

ZOMBIE_HEAD = (0, 180, 0)

RED_EYES = (200, 0, 0)

SKY_DARK = (40, 40, 60)

clock = pygame.time.Clock()

FPS = 60

bg_x = 0

bg_speed = 2

class Dino:

def \__init_\_(self):

    self.width = 60

    self.height = 60

    self.x = 100

    self.y = HEIGHT - self.height - 50

    self.vel_y = 0

    self.jump_power = -15

    self.gravity = 1

    self.is_jumping = False

    self.rect = pygame.Rect(self.x, self.y, self.width, self.height)

def jump(self):

    if not self.is_jumping:

        self.vel_y = self.jump_power

        self.is_jumping = True

def update(self):

    self.vel_y += self.gravity

    self.y += self.vel_y

    if self.y \>= HEIGHT - self.height - 50:

        self.y = HEIGHT - self.height - 50

        self.is_jumping = False

        self.vel_y = 0

    self.rect.topleft = (self.x, self.y)

def draw(self):

    pygame.draw.rect(screen, (0, 100, 0), self.rect)

    pygame.draw.circle(screen, WHITE, (self.x + 15, self.y + 15), 8)

    pygame.draw.circle(screen, BLACK, (self.x + 18, self.y + 15), 4)

    pygame.draw.ellipse(screen, (0, 120, 0), (self.x + 45, self.y + 20, 20, 10))

class Zombie:

def \__init_\_(self):

    self.width = 50

    self.height = 80

    self.x = WIDTH

    self.y = HEIGHT - self.height - 50

    self.speed = 5

    self.rect = pygame.Rect(self.x, self.y, self.width, self.height)

def update(self, game_speed):

    self.speed = 5 + (game_speed // 10)

    self.x -= self.speed

    self.rect.topleft = (self.x, self.y)

def draw(self):

    pygame.draw.rect(screen, ZOMBIE_GREEN, (self.x + 10, self.y + 30, 30, 50))

    pygame.draw.circle(screen, ZOMBIE_HEAD, (self.x + 25, self.y + 15), 15)

    pygame.draw.circle(screen, RED_EYES, (self.x + 18, self.y + 12), 4)

    pygame.draw.circle(screen, RED_EYES, (self.x + 32, self.y + 12), 4)

    pygame.draw.rect(screen, ZOMBIE_GREEN, (self.x, self.y + 35, 15, 25))

    pygame.draw.rect(screen, ZOMBIE_GREEN, (self.x + 35, self.y + 35, 15, 25))

    pygame.draw.rect(screen, RED_EYES, (self.x + 20, self.y + 22, 10, 5))

def draw_ruined_building(x, y_bottom, width, height, color):

y = HEIGHT - y_bottom

pygame.draw.rect(screen, color, (x, y, width, height))

for i in range(0, height, 35):

    if random.random() \> 0.3:

        pygame.draw.rect(screen, BLACK, (x + 10, y + i + 10, 20, 20))

    else:

        pygame.draw.rect(screen, (50, 50, 50), (x + 10, y + i + 10, 20, 20))

    pygame.draw.rect(screen, BLACK, (x + width - 30, y + i + 10, 20, 20))

pygame.draw.polygon(screen, (60, 50, 40), \[(x + 15, y), (x + width - 15, y), (x + width // 2, y - 20)\])

def draw_background(bg_x_pos):

screen.fill(SKY_DARK)

offset1 = (bg_x_pos \* 0.4) % (WIDTH \* 2) - WIDTH

draw_ruined_building(offset1, 250, 140, 180, (80, 70, 50))

draw_ruined_building(offset1 + 350, 280, 100, 150, (90, 75, 55))

draw_ruined_building(offset1 + 700, 220, 120, 200, (70, 60, 45))

offset2 = (bg_x_pos \* 0.8) % (WIDTH \* 2) - WIDTH

draw_ruined_building(offset2, 180, 90, 130, RUINED_BROWN)

draw_ruined_building(offset2 + 250, 200, 110, 110, (110, 90, 70))

draw_ruined_building(offset2 + 550, 160, 85, 140, (95, 80, 60))

pygame.draw.rect(screen, BROWN, (0, HEIGHT - 50, WIDTH, 50))

for i in range(0, WIDTH, 100):

    pygame.draw.rect(screen, (50, 40, 20), ((bg_x_pos + i) % WIDTH, HEIGHT - 70, 30, 20))

# Oyun objeleri

dino = Dino()

zombies = []

score = 0

font = pygame.font.SysFont("Arial", 30, bold=True)

game_over = True # Başlangıçta beklesin

spawn_timer = 0

bg_x = 0

running = True

while running:

clock.tick(FPS)

bg_x -= bg_speed + (score // 50)

draw_background(bg_x)

for event in pygame.event.get():

    if event.type == pygame.QUIT:

        running = False

    if event.type == pygame.KEYDOWN:

        if event.key == pygame.K_SPACE or event.key == pygame.K_UP:

            if game_over:

                dino = Dino()

                zombies = \[\]

                score = 0

                game_over = False

                spawn_timer = 0

                bg_x = 0

            else:

                dino.jump()

    if event.type == pygame.MOUSEBUTTONDOWN or event.type == pygame.FINGERDOWN:  # Dokunmatik!

        if game_over:

            dino = Dino()

            zombies = \[\]

            score = 0

            game_over = False

            spawn_timer = 0

            bg_x = 0

        else:

            dino.jump()

if not game_over:

    spawn_timer += 1

    if spawn_timer \> random.randint(90, 180):

        zombies.append(Zombie())

        spawn_timer = 0

    dino.update()

    for zombie in zombies\[:\]:

        zombie.update(score)

        if zombie.x \< -zombie.width:

            zombies.remove(zombie)

            score += 1

        if dino.rect.colliderect(zombie.rect):

            game_over = True

dino.draw()

for zombie in zombies:

    zombie.draw()

score_text = font.render(f"Skor: {score}", True, WHITE)

screen.blit(score_text, (WIDTH - 180, 20))

if game_over:

    title_text = font.render("IROTEZN GAME - Zombi Kaçış!", True, WHITE)

    start_text = font.render("Başlatmak için SPACE veya DOKUN!", True, WHITE)

    screen.blit(title_text, (WIDTH // 2 - title_text.get_width() // 2, HEIGHT // 2 - 40))

    screen.blit(start_text, (WIDTH // 2 - start_text.get_width() // 2, HEIGHT // 2))

pygame.display.update()

pygame.quit()

sys.exit()

Q: Azure Blob Storage File Paths A:

container_name/user_Id/group_Id/item_Id/image.jpg

As mentioned by @Zhaoxing Lu - Microsoft, By including path information in blob names, you can create a virtual directory structure you can organize and traverse as you would a traditional file system. The directory structure is virtual only--the only resources available in Blob storage are containers and blobs. However, the storage client library offers a CloudBlobDirectory object to refer to a virtual directory and simplify the process of working with blobs that are organized in this way

For example, consider the following set of block blobs in a container named photos:

photo1.jpg
2010/architecture/description.txt
2010/architecture/photo3.jpg
2010/architecture/photo4.jpg
2011/architecture/photo5.jpg
2011/architecture/photo6.jpg
2011/architecture/description.txt
2011/photo7.jpg

Full documentation can be found here
